I see we have some very rude comments being made! Do you think it is a good idea to debate snide remarks? Maybe we should start a thread for that!

Fun debates may be different. They are meaningless and pointless.
 
 Then, some are just weird.

I would say to that debating snide remarks IS meaningless and pointless, wouldn't you? Mostly I was speaking of other threads in other forums where people seem compelled to be obsessively defensive. I am sorry if I posted this topic in the wrong forum, I am new here. emoticon_xangel
Only an idiot would want to debate snide remarks!

And a good communicator would return the favor with a sarcastic or ironic comment. That usually pi**** off the person who made the rude comment, if the comment was directed at you and you don't want to let it go or want to get even. The only thing you have to watch out that you don't involve yourself in a verbal fight. Unless of course you are able to keep you cool and don't sink to his or her level. Even then you limit it to a few replys. More than that is meaningless because he or she doesn't get it and in the end you just waste your time.

Is a snide remark the same as a personal attack? Just asking....see, I have noticed that it seems that people resort to snide remarks when they are "losing" or at least not sure how to get their point across without resorting to such.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Debating snide remarks?
